DOC.HEADLINE: Paper check system created to prevent plagiarism among Chinese students

TEXT.P: A university term paper checking system was developed in China by its second largest computer producer after Lenovo, TsinghuaTongfang, to prevent plagiarism among college students, Beijing-based China Youth Daily reported Thursday.

The Paper Misconduct Literature Check System (PMLC) is capable of checking students' term papers, course work, experimental and investigation reports to find similarities among students' works, Sun Xiongyong, an expert from Tsinghua Tongfang, was quoted as saying.

Besides checking students' papers, the system has a credit database to record students' misconduct in plagiarism. There is also an archive of students' papers to prevent their being copied from each other, Sun said.

The creation of the PMLC was due to the requirement of many universities who believe plagiarism among students was "quite common". So far, 88 Chinese universities have signed agreements with the company to use the PMLC, Sun said.

A recently finished survey, which was conducted by the East China Normal University on college students' online behavior, showed that about 57% of respondents admitted they have copied research from online resources at least once.
